question: What is ess
answer:
Hello! 😊 

**ESS Overview**

ESS stands for Employee Self-Service. It is a digital platform that allows employees to manage various aspects of their employment, including personal information, transport services, and timesheet submissions. 

**Key Features of ESS:**

- **Personal Information Management:** Employees can update their personal details such as home address and contact numbers through the ESS portal .
  
- **Transport Services:** Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS) and taxi rentals, via the ESS platform . 

- **Timesheet Management:** ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Management Applications:** Employees can navigate to various management tools, such as the Budget Management System, through the ESS page .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the specific documents mentioned above.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific functionalities does the ESS platform offer for transport services?
2. How can employees update their personal information in the ESS?
3. What steps should be taken if an employee encounters issues with their timesheet in ESS?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0 

© This is the exclusive property of Bosch Global Software Technologies Private Limited.

context.content:
For more details please Click [ here ]( https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20do%20I%20Recall%20already%20Submitted%20OR%20Approved%20Timesheets) But if timesheet period is closed then it is possible to regularize the efforts by applying Efforts Not Booked (ENB) leave type in ESS. Associate will be able to opt ENB option only after 16 days from the day the timesheet period is closed in PRIME    

Question 628) My project is not appearing in prime tool timesheet, Due to this I am not able to fill the efforts. Please help me as soon as possible since the period is about to get closed?  
Answer: If the scheduled task in MPP, is not reflecting in Timesheet. Please watch this [ Video]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_vvz5bo7u) to see the possible causes for the same and steps to overcome.  

Question 629) I am not able to find how many have submitted the timesheet in History.  
Answer: If you are interested to see the daily saved/submitted/approved efforts then please go through 'Effort Dashboard' [ link]( https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4).   And if you want to see how many of your associates are not submitted the timesheet then go through this Bosch Connect [ link](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20to%20find%20the%20list%20of%20Timesheets%20not%20submitted%20by%20associates).   In case you just need to check names of associates who have entered timesheet for today, you can refer "Today's Timesheet Effort" option available in PRIME home page  

Question 630) My project is applicable for Cost of Quality report but not able to find in the list.  
Answer: Be notified that:   1.Cost of Quality Report is Not applicable for : RA / Innovation / Competency / ESS / Agile - SCRUM / Agile - SAFe category of projects.

GD&T Course content per ISO GPS standards 
 

1. Pre assessment test to understand the skills of participants 

2. Basics of ISO-GPS system of standards (ISO 8015) 

1 Objectives of the ISO-GPS system of standards (ISO 8015) 

2 Structure of the ISO-GPS system of standards 

2.1 Fundamental ISO-GPS standards 

2.2 General ISO-GPS standards 

3 Concepts, principals and rules acc. to ISO 8015:2011 

3. ISO 2768 general tolerances  

4. Dimensional tolerances (ISO 14405) 

1 Problem of unambiguous sizes 

2 Feature of size with linear sizes-terms acc. to ISO 14405-1: 2017 

3 Linear distances and radii (non-sizes) acc. to ISO 14405-2: 2017 

4 feature of size with angular size-terms acc. to ISO 14405-3:2017 

5 Two-point-size and consequences for technical drawings 

6 Envelope requirement acc. to ISO 14405-1 

7 Modifiers to specify the linear size characteristic (“GG”, “GN”, “LP”, etc.) 

5. Geometrical product specifications (GPS) —Geometrical tolerancing — 

          Datums and datum systems (ISO 5459:2011) 

1 Symbols, terms and definitions. 

2 Role of datums and general concepts 

3 Specification of datums and datum systems 

4 Single datum established from one single feature 

5 Common datum established from more than one feature 

6 Specification of datums and datum systems 

7. Datum targets 

 

 

 

 

 



E I S 
                       

           Engineering and Industrial Services 
 

Regd. Office 101, Saiswathi Apartment, Plot No 124 & 125 VI Phase KPHB, 
Kukatpally, Hyderabad 500072 Phone: 040-23157612  

 

6. Geometrical product specifications (GPS) — Geometrical tolerancing — Tolerances of form, 

orientation, location and run-out (ISO 1101: 2017) 

1 Tolerance indicator: composition and indication rules 

2 Geometrical characteristics 

3 Tolerance zone (form, width, orientation)

context.content:
Applicable to all BGSW on-roll associates, external associates, trainees & interns. To have hassle-free transport under digital platform at Ban, Cob, Hyd & Pune.
Responsibility
FCM Department
Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

question: how to raise IT service ticket
answer:
To raise an IT service ticket, follow these steps:

1. **Click the Link:** Go to the IT service management portal by clicking this link: [IT Service Management Portal](https://service-management.bosch.tech/sp).

2. **Select Get Support:** Once on the portal, select the option for "Get Support."

3. **Open a Ticket:** Choose "open a ticket."

4. **Fill in Details:**
   - Enter the necessary information in the "Ticket Summary" and "Ticket Details" sections.
   - Attach any relevant files if needed.

5. **Submit the Ticket:** After filling in all the required details, click on "Submit" to raise your ticket.

You will receive a confirmation once your ticket is successfully created. 

For further assistance, you can also navigate through the Employee Self-Service portal to access OneIDM & BGSW IT Applications Support for additional support requests .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What types of issues can be reported through the IT service ticket system?
2. How can I check the status of my submitted IT service ticket?
3. What should I do if I encounter problems while raising a ticket?

context.content:
Answer: For raising a IT service ticket click the link - https://service-management.bosch.tech/sp
 Select --> Get Support --> Select "open a ticket" --> Fill the necessary details in "Ticket Summary" and "Ticket details" and add the attachments --> Click "Submit"

Question 77) How to create an SMT ticket?
Answer: For raising a SMT ticket click the link - https://service-management.bosch.tech/sp
Select --> Get Support --> Select "open a ticket" --> Fill the necessary details in "Ticket Summary" and "Ticket details" and add the attachments --> Click "Submit"

Question 78) How to get access for manager self service to approval E-separation for employee
Answer: Step 1: kindly click the link for open oneIDM: https://oneidm.bosch.com/oneidm/html/rbwebshop/#/start/itshop/VI_Start
Step 2: Click Request--> New Request  --> Click the Select IT application --> Search "PH1011, PXG011 & Portal" IT application
Step 3: Select Filter option in "Services" Search For ( In PH1 - X:H0HR_INXX_MA_MSS) (In PXG -  X:0GHR_FIORI_HCM_IN_MSS_PH1) (In Portal - CN=org_every_rbei_group_manager,OU=portal,OU=groups,OU=esi,DC=wam-bosch,DC=com) and select the check box and click to "Add to Shopping Cart".
Step 4: Select the shopping Cart symbol in top right side of oneIDM --.>Select "Shopping Cart" -->Click the  option "Edit". 
Step 5: Enter the detailed business justification in "Reason". Select Validity date from to End. Click "Save" --> Click "submit"
Step 5: Combined Request Number will generate after the Submission.
Step 6: To check the status in oneIDM Click Request--> Find request --> Enter CRN in "Search by Request Id" check the Status column, Initially the status was updated as "New" once the status changed to "Assigned". Kindly try to access the application after status changed to assigned.

Question 79) How to get access to approve travel settlement for employee
Answer: Step 1: kindly click the link for open oneIDM: https://oneidm.bosch.com/oneidm/html/rbwebshop/#/start/itshop/VI_Start

context.content:
If prompted, “Login with SSO” using NTID, or you can also create ticket by navigating from Employee Self Service portal -> OneIDM & BGSW IT Applications Support  OneIDM Support Request
Step 1: Click "Request for" select "Myself or Others"  
Step 2: Enter the "Beneficiary NT ID"  
Step 3: Select Application as "oneIDM" 
Step 4: Select module as "others"  
Step 5: Enter the "Business reason" in the "Business justification for access". 
Step 6: Enter the details about access or issue in "Describe access right /Tcode / Issue" 
Step 7: Add any error screenshot as attachment  
Step 8: Click "Submit", Servicenow ticket will be created.
Step 9: An email notification will be triggered when a ticket is created, and the ticket status can be checked in the ServiceNow portal. Additionally, email notifications will be sent for every update or change to the ticket.
Step 10: To check the status of created ticket in servicenow portal, Kindly click the "Request" option, created ticket number will listed there and user can check the ticket status.

Question 15) Uanble to access HR Core ESS/MSS
Answer: Step 1: Kindly check the access in oneIDM for default access in PH1011 & PXG011 IT applications. for checking the access rights kindly click the link: https://oneidm.bosch.com/oneidm/html/rbwebshop/#/start/itshop/VI_Start
Step 2: Click Request--> Extend or Revoke --> Click the filter option in IT application --> Search PH1011, PXG011 & Portal IT application

Question 11) How to get additional access in additional GB/BU in iGPM-MCR : XC, VM, ME
Answer: Step 1: For initiating the access in oneIDM, kindly click the link:     https://oneidm.bosch.com/oneidm/html/rbwebshop/#/start/itshop/VI_Start
Step 2: Click Request--> New Request  --> Click the Select IT application --> Search iGPM IT application
Step 3: Select Filter option in "Services" Search the required roles and select the Suitable roles and click to "Add to Shopping Cart".
Step 4: Select the shopping Cart symbol in top right side of oneIDM --.>Select "Shopping Cart" -->Click the  option "Edit". 
Step 5: Enter the detailed business justification in "Reason". Select Validity date from to End. Click "Save" --> Click "submit"
Step 5: Combined Request Number will generate after the Submission.
Step 6: To check the status in oneIDM Click Request--> Find request --> Enter CRN in "Search by Request Id" check the Status column, Initially the status was updated as "New" once the status changed to "Assigned". Kindly try to access the application after status changed to assigned.

Still you are unable to access the Application kindly register your request / query through the link - https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=ed35579747e1ce10750cc6de116d4319
If prompted, “Login with SSO” using NTID, or you can also create ticket by navigating from Employee Self Service portal -> OneIDM & BGSW IT Applications Support  OneIDM Support Request
Step 1: Click "Request for" select "Myself or Others"  
Step 2: Enter the "Beneficiary NT ID"  
Step 3: Select Application as "oneIDM" 
Step 4: Select module as "iGPM"  
Step 5: Enter the "Business reason" in the "Business justification for access".
